p:
We first prepared the 70% ethanol extract of S. baicalensis and tested its inhibitory activity against SARS-CoV-2 3CL pro. We expressed SARS-CoV-2 3CL pro and performed activity assay using a peptide substrate (Thr-Ser-Ala-Val-Leu-Gln-pNA) according to the published procedure of SARS-CoV 3CL pro assay
10
,
34 . As shown in Figure 1(A), the crude extract exhibits significant inhibitory effect with an IC 50 of 8.5 µg/ml, suggesting that S. baicalensis contains candidate inhibitory ingredients against SARS-CoV-2 3CL pro.
